item.title: Boris Johnson to set out England's final Covid lockdown easing
item.description: Boris Johnson will use Monday's press conference to confirm the next steps on social distancing and masks.

item.title: Queen gives George Cross to NHS for staff's 'courage and dedication'
item.description: It comes as the health service marks its 73rd anniversary on Monday with events across the UK.

item.title: Afghanistan: All foreign troops must leave by deadline - Taliban
item.description: The group's stance comes amid reports US forces will stay to protect embassies and an airport.

item.title: Grenfell prompts creation of building safety regulator
item.description: The new watchdog will be able to prosecute rule-breaking developers and take their properties off the market.

item.title: Pope 'responds well' to colon surgery at Rome hospital
item.description: The 84-year-old underwent an operation to deal with an issue with his colon, the Vatican says.

item.title: After Lod violence, Israeli city's residents fear for the future
item.description: Both Jewish and Arab Israelis feel unprotected after intercommunal violence in the Israeli city.

item.title: Covid: Train bosses say social distancing not always possible
item.description: Wales' train operator says it is not always possible to enforce Covid rules during busy times.

item.title: Miami collapse: Crews prepare for demolition as storm nears
item.description: A standing portion of the collapsed building will be brought down before search efforts can resume.

item.title: Britain's Raducanu to headline Court One
item.description: British wildcard Emma Raducanu headlines a mouth-watering day of fourth-round singles action on the show courts on day seven of Wimbledon.

item.title: Strabane: Large fire has broken out at coffin makers
item.description: Eighty firefighters and 14 appliances tackled the fire at Railway Street in Strabane.

item.title: Cyprus: Nations send help to tackle worst wildfire in decades
item.description: Four missing people are confirmed dead as a huge blaze forces the evacuation of several villages.

item.title: Didi ordered off China's app stores by nation's cyber regulator
item.description: The ride-hailing app is facing regulatory problems at home, days after its New York share launch.

item.title: Covid: Parents' relief as hospital visit rules change
item.description: New guidance would allow any visitors if they have a negative Covid test.

item.title: The Papers: PM to unveil unlocking plans, and 'George Cross for NHS'
item.description: Monday's papers lead with details of which measures are expected to be lifted in England after 19 July.

item.title: Where is the anti-lockdown movement headed?
item.description: What is set to become of the growing anti-lockdown movement once Covid restrictions are lifted?

item.title: Olympic hopeful spent lockdown training 'in a makeshift pool'
item.description: Record-breaking 17-year-old Evie Davis from Bromley has set her sights on swimming at the Olympics in Paris.

item.title: Brexit: Exporting my fish to China is easier than to France
item.description: A Scottish fisherman says post-Brexit rules means three hours worth of paperwork for each EU order.

item.title: Escaping a serial killer - and moving on
item.description: Kara Chamberlain was kidnapped when she was 15. Now she talks about her trauma on social media.

item.title: UFOs: 'These objects show physics we don't understand'
item.description: An astronautical engineering expert on the unanswered questions in the US government's UFO report.

item.title: Israeli videographer goes viral with sheep drone shots
item.description: Lior Patel's drone footage of sheep has been viewed more than 100,000 times on Facebook.

item.title: Portal: Lithuania and Poland build a window connecting two cities
item.description: Residents of Vilnius, Lithuania and Lublin, Poland are now connected by a 'portal' between the cities.

item.title: Prince Charles reveals favourite songs in radio show to thank volunteers
item.description: The future king highlights one 1970s pop hit which gave him "an irresistible urge to dance".

item.title: Jump rope: 'Buying a skipping rope saved me, mentally'
item.description: Lauren lost her job and had to delay her wedding during the pandemic but is now a social media star.

item.title: What we can all learn from Britney Spears’ case
item.description: The pop star’s conservatorship has shed light on our treatment of female celebrities in the 2000s.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'animal crossing'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Week in pictures: 26 June - 2 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: How cattle are helping rare butterflies to thrive at Mabie Forest
item.description: Pearl-bordered fritillary numbers are rising at one site - with some unusual assistance.

item.title: Benefits and disability: 'I'll never cohabit again, to protect myself'
item.description: Some disabled people have been left uncomfortably reliant on partners after benefits were removed.

item.title: Is the use of jetpacks finally about to take off?
item.description: Members of the public can now pay to fly through the air like a superhero.

item.title: Letter from Africa: Lamenting the Algeria-Morocco border closure
item.description: The Morocco-Algeria border has been closed for decades, despite close ties between the people.

item.title: Pandemic investing: 'Using my part-time pay to invest in stocks'
item.description: Interest in investing and trading grew during the Covid pandemic, but experts warn of the risks.

item.title: Archaeologists dig in over planning reforms row
item.description: Experts warn history and heritage could be lost if they are excluded from the government's new plans.

item.title: Protests, pet thefts and sex crimes: MPs want changes to the policing bill
item.description: The controversial Policing, Crime, Sentencing and Courts bill is back in the Commons on Monday.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu's arrest leaves Nigeria's Ipob separatists in disarray
item.description: Igbo separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu was largely ignored until his movement became an armed struggle.

item.title: Parents of children called Alexa challenge Amazon
item.description: Youngsters are being bullied over their name - also the default wake word for the tech firm's smart speakers.

item.title: England dominate Sri Lanka again but denied victory by weather
item.description: England win their one-day international series against Sri Lanka 2-0 after the third match in Bristol is washed out.

item.title: O'Connor claims stage nine victory as Pogacar retains overall Tour de France lead
item.description: Australia's Ben O'Connor soloes to victory on stage nine of the Tour de France as Tadej Pogacar extends his overall race lead.

item.title: Prolific Adams aims for Lions Test spot as he prepares to become a father
item.description: Wales wing Josh Adams is hoping his British and Irish Lions try-scoring exploits have put down a marker for a Test spot against South Africa.

item.title: What kind of manager are Crystal Palace getting in Vieira?
item.description: What kind of a managerial appointment will Patrick Vieira be for Crystal Palace? How has his coaching career gone so far?

item.title: When in Rome... How players, pundits & fans reacted to England's incredible win
item.description: Relive the best action and reactions after England's incredible 4-0 victory over Ukraine in Rome to set up a Euro 2020 semi-final against Denmark at Wembley.

item.title: England v Sri Lanka ODI: Bairstow makes fine diving catch as Tom Curran picks up third wicket
item.description: Jonny Bairstow leaps full stretch to his right to make a fine one-handed catch to remove Dimuth Karunaratne as Tom Curran picks up his third wicket in the third ODI against Sri Lanka.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Millions of people most vulnerable to Covid-19 may be offered a third vaccination in September.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are under review.

item.title: Covid: Will free school meals continue over summer holidays?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: There is 'no reason' for England's final Covid restrictions to last beyond 19 July, the government says.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What are the social distancing rules and when could they end?
item.description: It's not clear whether we will still have to wear masks and socially distance once lockdown eases.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'Coercion and rape': Investigating my yoga school
item.description: Ishleen Kaur was passionate about yoga movement Sivananda, until she found allegations of sexual abuse.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.
